meanings.definition: To run faster than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah outruns the lion in a race.
meanings.sent2: The hare outruns the tortoise in the famous fable.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outruns the bird to the nut, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His determination outruns his physical limitations.
meanings.sent5: The Olympic sprinter outruns all competitors with ease.

meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or distance.
meanings.sent1: The new sports car outruns all other vehicles on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The express train outruns the local train to the next station.
meanings.sent3: The wind outruns the storm, reaching safety first.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition outruns her peers, propelling her to success.
meanings.sent5: The champion racehorse outruns its rivals by a large margin.
